data: The text is placed on the underside of the foot.
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana
Iscrizioni greche archaiche di Sicilia e Magna Grecia. Iscrizioni di Sicilia. II. Iscrizioni di Gela e di Agrigento
R. Arena, Iscrizioni Greche Archaiche Di Sicilia e Magna Grecia. Iscrizioni Di Sicilia. II. Iscrizioni Di Gela e Di Agrigento, 2nd ed., vol. 2, 5 vols (Alessandria: Edizioni dell’Orso, 2002)
Inscriptions grecques dialectales de Sicile : contribution à l'étude du vocabulaire grec colonial
L. Dubois, Inscriptions Grecques Dialectales de Sicile : Contribution à l’étude Du Vocabulaire Grec Colonial, CEFR 119 (Rome: Ecole française de Rome, 1989)
M.T. Manni Piraino, ‘Nuove Iscrizioni Dall’acropoli Di Gela’, in Philias Charin. Miscellanea Di Studi Classici in Onore Di Eugenio Manni, vol. 5, 6 vols (Rome, 1980), 1767–1831
·ΕΥΚ·ΡΙΔΑΣ

1interpunctΕΥΚinterpunctΡΙΔΑΣ

1interpunctΕΥΚinterpunctΡΙΔΑΣ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after photograph ;
  • Arena: Εὐαρίδας or Εὐχρίδας ;
  • Dubois: Εὐχρίδας or Εὐαρίδας

English translation

Valentina Mignosa

Italian translation

Valentina Mignosa

commentary

The text has been variously interpreted. Dubois reads it as Εὐαρίδας if the third letter is an alpha (thus admitting a different ductus for the two alphas in the inscription) or as Εὐχρίδας if the third sign should be read as a chi (a 'red' variant expected in Gela). Arena reads as Εὐαρίδας also admitting a different ductus for the two alphas, the first of which he defines as 'Sikan' (though, this would rather be a 'Sikel' alpha similar to those attested in Sikel inscriptions from eastern Sicily, cf. e.g. ISic003364) or as Εὐχρίδας admitting the presence of a red chi. However, we seem to be able to see a division between the first part of the word and the second, marked (perhaps) by some sort of punctuation. Moreover, the third sign, rather than a red chi or a Sikel alpha, seems to be a corrected upsilon (a dittography) to obtain another letter, perhaps a kappa. In addition to the unusual ductus of the third sign, which could be the result of a correction, the aberrant ductus of delta, rho and sigma could suggest a text that is alien to the Geloan context.

bibliography

  • Arena 2002 53, pl. XIX.2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001373
  • 29.0843 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • Dubois 1989 144c https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000187
  • Manni Piraino 1980 1782-1783, no.11, pl. 3 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001765
